story_title: The Silent Warning: Dr. Erben's Carotid Stenosis Story - V2

dr_erben.physical: Petite, 40s, expressive rectangular glasses, black hair in practical ponytail
dr_erben.background: Grew up in Venezuela, multilingual vascular surgeon

style: Dora the Explorer cartoon - thick black outlines (3-4px), flat bright colors, expressive faces, landscape 1536x1024

panels.title: Emergency Arrival
panels.scene: St. Maria Hospital emergency department entrance at 2:47 PM. Carmen Rodriguez (67, Venezuelan woman) supported by daughter Maria and son-in-law Jorge walking through automatic doors.
panels.educational_focus: TIA symptoms prompt immediate ER visit

panels.title: Dr. Erben - First Meeting in Spanish
panels.scene: Exam room. Dr. Yuna Erben (petite Korean woman, 40s, expressive rectangular glasses, teal scrubs, black hair in ponytail) introduces herself in Spanish, sitting at eye level with Carmen.
key_elements: Dr. Erben on stool at patient eye level
panels.educational_focus: Cultural competence and trust-building through language

panels.title: Physical Exam - Carotid Bruit Discovery
panels.scene: Dr. Erben listening to Carmen's right neck with stethoscope. Close-up of stethoscope placement over carotid artery.
panels.educational_focus: Carotid bruit indicates turbulent flow from stenosis

panels.title: FAST Assessment Teaching
panels.scene: Dr. Erben teaching FAST stroke recognition using tablet. Maria demonstrates each component.
panels.educational_focus: FAST acronym: Face, Arms, Speech, Time for stroke recognition

panels.title: TIA Pathophysiology - Water Pipe Analogy
panels.scene: Whiteboard with Dr. Erben's drawing of pipe with sediment buildup, showing plaque breaking off and traveling to brain.
panels.educational_focus: Atherosclerosis mechanism, embolization causing TIA

panels.title: Carotid Duplex Ultrasound Procedure
panels.scene: Vascular lab. Ultrasound technologist Sandra applying gel to Carmen's neck with probe. Machine showing waveforms.
panels.educational_focus: Carotid duplex ultrasound - primary diagnostic tool

panels.title: Ultrasound Results - 85% Stenosis
panels.scene: Exam room computer showing ultrasound images. Dr. Erben pointing to narrowed artery on screen, explaining to Carmen and Maria.
panels.educational_focus: NASCET criteria, severe stenosis definition (>70%)

panels.title: CT Angiography - 3D Mapping
panels.scene: Dr. Erben at workstation with 3D reconstruction of carotid arteries on large monitor. Rotating view showing plaque in detail.
panels.educational_focus: Advanced imaging for surgical planning

panels.title: Neurology Consultation
panels.scene: Conference room. Dr. Erben and Dr. James Park (neurologist) reviewing Carmen's case on large screen showing images and data.
panels.educational_focus: Multidisciplinary stroke prevention team

panels.title: Family Meeting - Anatomical Model Education
panels.scene: Consultation room. Dr. Erben demonstrating with 3D anatomical model of carotid arteries, showing removable plaque section to family.
panels.educational_focus: Carotid anatomy: common, internal, external branches

panels.title: Treatment Options - Shared Decision Making
panels.scene: Dr. Erben showing comparison chart on tablet: Medical Management vs Surgery vs Stenting, with risk percentages.
panels.educational_focus: Evidence-based treatment options, NASCET/ECST trial data

panels.title: Decision to Proceed - Personal Connection
panels.scene: Dr. Erben holding Carmen's hand, discussing Venezuelan heritage connection. Carmen decides to proceed with surgery.
panels.educational_focus: Informed consent and patient choice

panels.title: Cardiac Clearance
panels.scene: Dr. Lisa Chen (cardiologist) examining Carmen, reviewing EKG and echocardiogram results. All normal - cleared for surgery.
panels.educational_focus: Pre-operative cardiac assessment for vascular surgery

panels.title: Surgical Planning - Late Night Prep
panels.scene: Evening. Dr. Erben in surgical planning room with three monitors showing CT, ultrasound, angiogram. Tea cup nearby, focused concentration.
panels.educational_focus: Meticulous surgical planning using multimodal imaging

panels.title: Anesthesia Consultation - Neuromonitoring Plan
panels.scene: Dr. Kevin O'Brien (anesthesiologist) explaining anesthesia plan and EEG neuromonitoring to Carmen using diagrams.
panels.educational_focus: Anesthesia considerations for carotid surgery, neuromonitoring

panels.title: Patient Education with Physical Models
panels.scene: Dr. Erben with tackle box of teaching models. Clear plastic artery showing plaque, clean artery model, zipper model for arteriotomy demonstration.
panels.educational_focus: Surgical technique education using tactile models

panels.title: Informed Consent - Full Risk Disclosure
panels.scene: Formal consent session with certified Spanish interpreter on video. Dr. Erben reviewing all risks with Carmen and Maria.
panels.educational_focus: Surgical risks: stroke, death, nerve injury, bleeding

panels.title: Night Before Surgery - Dr. Erben's Final Review
panels.scene: 10:47 PM. Dr. Erben at home kitchen table with surgical atlas (Rutherford's Vascular Surgery), cat on lap, phone showing text from brother in Korea.
panels.educational_focus: Surgeon preparation and continuing education
panels.emotion: Quiet dedication, pre-operative ritual, family support

panels.title: Morning of Surgery - Patient Preparation
panels.scene: 5:30 AM - 6:15 AM montage. Dr. Erben's morning routine, arriving at hospital, changing to scrubs. Carmen in pre-op area with IV, family present.
key_elements: Split panel: Dr. Erben prep / Carmen prep
panels.educational_focus: Pre-operative preparation for patient and surgeon

panels.title: Scrubbing In - The Ritual
panels.scene: 6:55 AM. Dr. Erben at scrub sink, methodical hand washing. View through OR window showing room setup. Nurse Tammy visible arranging instruments.
panels.educational_focus: Surgical sterility and preparation ritual
panels.emotion: Calm focus, ritual precision, ready to operate

panels.title: Operating Room Setup
panels.scene: OR 4. Carmen positioned on table, shoulder roll, head turned left. Dr. Erben on step stool at right side. Team performing timeout.
panels.educational_focus: OR setup, surgical safety checklist (timeout)

panels.title: Skin Incision
panels.scene: Close-up of neck with drawn incision line (10cm along sternocleidomastoid). Dr. Erben making first incision with scalpel.
panels.educational_focus: Surgical approach: longitudinal incision along SCM

panels.title: Dissection to Carotid Bifurcation
panels.scene: Deeper dissection. Dr. Erben using forceps and cautery, dividing platysma muscle. Internal jugular vein visible, carotid beneath fascia.
panels.educational_focus: Anatomical layers: skin, platysma, fascia, vessels

panels.title: Isolating the Arteries
panels.scene: Carotid bifurcation exposed. Vessel loops around common, internal, and external carotid. Hypoglossal nerve visible above, retracted gently.
panels.educational_focus: Carotid bifurcation anatomy, nerve preservation

panels.title: Heparinization
panels.scene: Dr. O'Brien injecting heparin into IV. Timer showing 7:48 AM. Dr. Erben continuing distal dissection while waiting for heparin effect.
panels.educational_focus: Systemic anticoagulation before arterial clamping

panels.title: Clamping Sequence
panels.scene: Dr. Erben placing DeBakey clamps sequentially: common carotid (first), internal carotid (second), external carotid (third). Blood flow stopped.
panels.educational_focus: Clamping sequence, neuromonitoring during cerebral ischemia

panels.title: Arteriotomy
panels.scene: Dr. Erben using Potts scissors to open artery longitudinally. Incision extending from common carotid across plaque to internal carotid.
panels.educational_focus: Arteriotomy technique with specialized scissors

panels.title: Visualizing the Plaque
panels.scene: Artery open, interior exposed. Yellow-white atherosclerotic plaque visible with ulcerations, calcifications. Dr. Erben and fellow examining closely.
panels.educational_focus: Atherosclerotic plaque pathology, vulnerable plaque features

panels.title: Plaque Removal - Endarterectomy
panels.scene: Dr. Erben using spatula and dissection, developing plane between plaque and arterial wall. Plaque separating cleanly.
panels.educational_focus: Endarterectomy plane: between diseased intima and healthy media

panels.title: Plaque Specimen Removed
panels.scene: Dr. Erben holding extracted plaque specimen (2.5cm, yellowish rubbery cast). Inspecting endarterectomy bed which is smooth and glistening.
panels.educational_focus: Complete plaque removal, smooth endarterectomy bed

panels.title: Inspecting and Tacking
panels.scene: Dr. Erben inspecting endarterectomy bed meticulously. Placing single 7-0 Prolene tack stitch at distal intimal edge.
panels.educational_focus: Ensuring smooth transition, preventing intimal flap elevation

panels.title: Patch Angioplasty Closure
panels.scene: Dr. Erben suturing bovine pericardial patch (1cm x 3cm oval) to close arteriotomy. Continuous 6-0 Prolene suture, even spacing.
panels.educational_focus: Patch angioplasty reduces re-stenosis vs primary closure

panels.title: Declamping and Flow Restoration
panels.scene: Dr. Erben removing clamps sequentially (external, internal with flush, common). Patch pulsing with blood flow. Time off clamp: 8:18, total 26 minutes.
panels.educational_focus: Declamping sequence, acceptable clamp times (<30 min ideal)

panels.title: Immediate Post-Op Neuro Check
panels.scene: PACU. Carmen waking up. Dr. Erben testing: squeeze hands (equal), stick out tongue (midline), say name (clear), raise arms (equal), push feet (strong).
panels.educational_focus: Immediate neurological assessment post-carotid surgery

panels.title: Blood Pressure Management
panels.scene: PACU nurse monitoring BP on screen (182/95). Dr. Erben ordering labetalol titration. BP adjusting to target 148/82.
panels.educational_focus: Post-CEA BP management: avoid extremes (hyper/hypotension)

panels.title: Family Reunion - Explaining Success
panels.scene: PACU. Maria hugging Carmen gently. Dr. Erben showing family intraoperative photos on tablet (plaque specimen, before/after).
panels.educational_focus: Patient/family education with intraoperative documentation

panels.title: Post-Op Day 1 - Early Mobilization
panels.scene: Carmen in chair eating breakfast. Jennifer (PT) helping her walk hospital hallway. Doppler check showing normal flow.
panels.educational_focus: Early mobilization prevents complications, Doppler follow-up

panels.title: Discharge Education - The Five Pillars
panels.scene: Dr. Erben teaching Five Pillars of stroke prevention on tablet: (1) Aspirin, (2) Statin, (3) BP control, (4) Diabetes management, (5) Lifestyle. Maria taking notes.
panels.educational_focus: Comprehensive stroke prevention: medications + lifestyle

panels.title: Two-Week Follow-Up
panels.scene: Clinic. Dr. Erben examining healed incision (thin pink line). Reviewing Carmen's medication compliance, BP log, blood sugar log. All excellent.
panels.educational_focus: Post-op wound healing, medication adherence monitoring

panels.title: Three-Month Success - Long-Term Prevention
panels.scene: Clinic. Carmen with grandchildren (3 kids). Ultrasound showing patent artery. Weight loss, improved labs. Dr. Erben teaching grandchildren about health. Final hug.
panels.educational_focus: Long-term success requires surgery + sustained prevention efforts
panels.emotion: Joy, gratitude, life extended, legacy, inspiration
